score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi health score indicates moderate performance with some congestion.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload stayed the same, ping worsened, and networks decreased.

latest_report.diagnosis: Your Wi-Fi is experiencing random dropouts likely due to congestion and interference from nearby networks. The signal strength is adequate, but there’s room for optimization.

performance.interpretation: Download speed is within an acceptable range for a 100 Mbps plan, while the upload speed is slightly below expectations. Overall latency (ping) is reasonable.

problems: High network congestion due to multiple overlapping SSIDs
Limited 5GHz availability due to many devices on congested channels
fixes: Change the 2.4GHz channel to 6 for less congestion (both channels 1 and 11 are crowded).
Switch the 5GHz channel to 149 or 153 to avoid interference from neighboring networks using 36 and 44.
Consider repositioning the router to a more central location to improve coverage.
Enable Band Steering to optimize device connections to the best available band automatically.
Regularly restart your router to help improve performance.
If possible, connect gaming devices directly via Ethernet for more stable connections.
